What is Orca-2?

Orca is an open-source framework for developing component-based robotic systems. It provides the means for defining and developing the building-blocks which can be pieced together to form arbitrarily complex robotic systems, from single vehicles to distributed sensor networks. Read more ...

The documentation on this web page matches the latest release of Orca-1. A web page is also generated hourly from the latest cvs version of Orca-2.

Current Status

The initial implementation based on selectable transport mechanisms has been frozen as of version 1.0 and will only receive bug fixes in the future. The framework has been and is currently used in several projects.

A new implementation has been started based on the Internet Communication Engine (Ice) from ZeroC. We call this implementation Orca-2. Our focus on component-based sotfware remains unchanged but we feel that Ice is far superior to any commercial and custom solutions we have looked at before. We are currently figuring out the best way to build components on top of Ice. A new distribution will be available soon.

News

  • 11-Oct-05: started development of Orca-2 using Ice.
  • 11-Oct-05: Orca 1.0.0: Orca-1 source has been frozen.
  • 18-Sep-05: Orca 0.15.2: Mostly small changes. See Release Notes for details.
  • 18-Aug-05: Orca 0.15.1: Mostly small bug-fixes.
  • 2-Jul-05: Orca 0.15.0:
    • Addition of SOCKET transport: a simple transport implementation using raw TCP/IP sockets
    • Various component improvements: see Release Notes for changes.
  • 9-May-05: Orca 0.14.0: See Release Notes for changes.
  • 16-Apr-05: Orca 0.13.3: See Release Notes for changes.
  • 4-Apr-05: Orca 0.13.2: See Release Notes for changes.
  • 21-Mar-05: Orca 0.13.1: XML config file system overhauled, and a bug fixed in playerbot.
  • 16-Mar-05: Orca 0.13.0: Enhancements:
    • Orca now has two options for transport mechanisms: (a) CORBA and (b) CRUD: a lightweight communications library based on UDP/Shared Memory.
    • The API for all Patterns and Objects has been significantly revamped, greatly improving consistency.
    • An automated testing setup has been added to run tests every night.
    • Dependency on log4cpp has been removed.
    • One additional pattern has been added for CRUD.
  • Old News
